posts.cooked: Is it possible to have Chinese to English translation in the conversation threads similarly to WeChat msgr? FYIâ€¦this conversation is not about how secure wechat is compared to signal, this is about language translation feature request in signal, either via auto or via manually. thanks.

link_counts.title: Implement online translator option for Signal

posts.cooked:
You can manually copy/paste messages into any translation service, but be aware that you would be sacrificing some security.

Signal likely would not be able to have built-in translation unless there is some kind of on-device translation service, because otherwise message content would have to be sent to an online translator.

posts.name: Gajanan Aiyer
posts.cooked:
Implement an auto-translation that allows a user to fluidly converse with vernacular language users

  1. when user sees a message in a language they cannot read confidently or at all, long pressing the message will reveal the translated option in a modal popup that must be dismissed to get back to the conversation

  2. when a user wants to reply to a non-english message in a translated language, they can choose to send with translation and a disclaimer to prevent any misunderstanding that may arise from translation error
FYI if you want to support the original feature request, make sure to click on the -button below it.

posts.name: Martin
posts.cooked: A feature that I would greatly appreciate, and Iâ€™m sure that would also be welcomed but everybody on the planet considering the age we live in, would be an instant translation feature. For example if somebody wrote a chat to me in a language that I donâ€™t understand so well, I could just select that chat and by the push of a button translate it into whatever language itâ€™s best for me. Similar to the way Google translate works but rather as a built-in feature into the signal app.

posts.name: lusignal
posts.cooked:
Am I mistaken in having a bad impression of how heavy the app would have to become if it was to be able to offer offline translation through lots of languages, even more in the vernacular? The only way I see this to be feasible is via a plugin system, which already has its own number of issues.

Translation would be nice to have, but itâ€™s way off-mission for Signal.

With the war in Ukraine and the millions of refugees, an integrated translation function for signal messages is urgently needed! Communication between Ukrainian- and Russian-speaking refugees and aid workers in European countries is a major daily hurdle. I donâ€™t know what effort it would take to implement such a function. But I see that to be able to use this function, many turn away from Signal and go to WhatsApp, Telegram or Viber, which have the translation functions integrated and you can communicate comfortably with them. My question and request: WHEN CAN SIGNAL DO THAT TOO??

Translated with DeepL Translate: The world's most accurate translator (free version)

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Not sure if there is any translation service which could be used off-line and be trusted with the content of your messages. I doubt it.

Those other apps donâ€™t really care that your message text can be analilized by Google for example.
You are right, this is certainly an issue! However, perhaps there options available without using google-translate. How about a cooperation between Signal and Deepl? Isnâ€™t deepl more trustworthy?

posts.name: Tamino
posts.cooked:
That you can long click on a message you got and select â€žTranslateâ€œ from this menu

image1125Ã—2436 74.3 KB

Privacy: Of course there will be people saying that this destroys privacy so i would say that when you hit the translate button for the first time, a pop up will be shown that you have to agree that this message is being translated with e.g Deepl or Google Translate. I even would suggest an option in settings to completely disable the feature if necessary.

posts.name: Derek Morr
posts.cooked:
I agree this would be useful, especially since competing messaging apps have it, There are offline translation models which could be incorporated into Signal to do this in a privacy preserving way, Two that come to mind are ArgosTranslate, which is used in LinreTranslate, and TranslateLocally, which is used in Firefoxâ€™s offline translation extension.

It would take some effort to evaluate the modelsâ€™ performance and quality, extract them from their repos, and adapt the code to work on all of Signalâ€™s supported ones, but it could be done.

link_counts.title: TranslateLocally for Firefox â€“ Get this Extension for ðŸ¦Š Firefox (en-GB)
LibreTranslate - Free and Open Source Machine Translation API
GitHub - argosopentech/argos-translate: Open-source offline translation library written in Python

posts.cooked: Recent versions of Android have a built-in live translate feature but for some reason itâ€™s not working on Signal. Works in WhatsApp and Google Messages.

Good evening, I am currently using a Telegram fork which is called Ayugram, this fork has an option which allows you to translate written messages that you are going to send, such as translating the messages of the opposite person, I was wondering if you could add this type of options that Ayugram has in the Signal application, I think it could be quite useful when interacting with users from other countries

posts.name: Vadim Kantorov
posts.cooked: Given rapid progress in open-source, small multi-language models, Signal could try doing on-device translation which would keep the messages private without resorting to server-processing or using third-party vendors

posts.name: makiro
posts.cooked: Firefox translation is a pretty decent open-source, on-device solution for translations.
